name: function 32
Documenta√ß√£o libgpiod
info:
Example:

gpioset gpiochip0 23=1

There are currently six command-line tools available:

* gpiodetect - list all gpiochips present on the system, their names, labels
               and number of GPIO lines

* gpioinfo   - list all lines of specified gpiochips, their names, consumers,
               direction, active state and additional flags

* gpioget    - read values of specified GPIO lines

* gpioset    - set values of specified GPIO lines, potentially keep the lines
               exported and wait until timeout, user input or signal

* gpiofind   - find the gpiochip name and line offset given the line name

* gpiomon    - wait for events on GPIO lines, specify which events to watch,
               how many events to process before exiting or if the events
               should be reported to the console

name: PINOUT
info:
1 - Sensor da tampa - Fio Vermelho (+)
9 - Sensor da tampa - Fio Preto (-)
15 - Sensor da tampa - Fio Verde (sinal)
17 - Led Verde - Fio Verde (+)
20 - Led Amarelo - Fio Amarelo (+)
21 - Led Vermelho - Fio vermelho (+)
25 - Comum aos leds - Fio branco (-)
36 - Buzzer - Fio Roxo (+)
39 - Buzzer - Fio Branco (-)
